There was one other sighting in Logan on or around August 2nd 2006
Summary: A bright red light that dimmed, followed by a row of yellow round lights lighting up one at a time in a clockwise pattern, revealing a disk shape.
divs: sighting detailswe've had some odd things going on in the last 3 weeks, including seeing a far away light resembling a star that would hover and then zip away... 20 minutes til 10 pm on tuesday, august 2nd was when it happened. it was dark, but in that post-dusk, ultra blue dark kind of way. a few of the brighter stars directly above us were peeping out at this point. the half-moon, waxing, was easily seen in the low southern sky, bright yellow but starting to turn orange as it dipped towards the horizen (of hills, for us.) it was clear of clouds, but a bit hazy, with no wind. i was on the deck, talking to my husband (who also witnessed the ufo) after the heat of the day, staring out vaguely westwards when out of the west\southwest i noticed some bright lights out of my peripheral vision, completely out of place. i stood up to see more clearly, as some leaves from a tree were in my way a bit. when i did i saw a couple of yellow lights next to each other wink out, followed by a red light-- like a super bright star-- flash, then get brighter-- much more so than any plane light, almost seeming to spin rapidly, then dim out swiftly until it disappeared. i exclaimed to my husband what i saw, thinking to myself that it was rather odd, and he only had time to see the end flash of the red light. however, i had no real opinion of what i was seeing at that point because the entire episode happened so quickly i didn't get a chance to really see it well enough to ascertain anything. but then, just as my husband was standing up to join me, yellow lights (in the exact position of the previous yellow lights and red spinning light) started to wink on-- all in a row-- round, clear, not too bright, but easily seen. one at a time they came on, and as they did, they appeared to be part of a disk-like object, about the size of a nickel held at arm's length to my perspective. the lights went on one at a time in a clock-wise direction at the rate of perhaps 2 per second. the object was cocked at a slight angle so that we saw slightly more of the bottom-side than the top-side. it was clear of the hills, but not too far above them. i yelped and my husband moved over to see better, then exclaimed that he was running in to get that fancy new camera of his. the lights then blinked off in a clock-wise direction, and without the lights on, the thing may as well have been invisible in the dark. nothing more happened that night, though i can assure you we scanned the skies for at least an hour after that! if you can imagine holding a nickel at arm's lenth and putting little lights around the rim, that's pretty close to what i would describe. i didn't believe what i was seeing even as i was looking at it-- and wondered if someone was pulling a prank with a balloon. though it would have had to have been, at the distance we saw it, a very large one. (at least 15 feet in diameter, but i'm guessing much more than that.) we live out in the hocking hills not far from old man's cave off h. 664, and have few neighbors, it would not be a very good place for a hoax. i've tried to think of what it could have been besides a high tech vehicle of some sort. it was not a conventional vehicle. not a plane, it hovered perfectly still. not a helicopter, as that close it would have made noise and what we saw was completely silent. other related sighting: the same red light that appears, flashes, spins, then dims out that i saw in between the yellow rim lights showed up again at about 10:01 pm the following evening, on august 3rd, in almost the same position, but a little further south in the sky. this time, there were no yellow rim lights however. we plan to go out tonight before 10 to see if there is any further activity. other note: we've seen some dark drab olive green military helicopters in the region in the last month, which is something neither of us have seen in this area ever in the years we've lived in this area of ohio. so there is a chance that maybe what we saw was part of some test i suppose.
